title: Grinding + EDM Engine Audit
scope: Grinding: 0 dedicated engines (4 inline actions), EDM: 4 dedicated engines

issues.finding: No dedicated grinding engine — all logic inline (75 lines of physics in dispatcher)
Burn threshold not physics-based — 500W arbitrary default, not Malkin's 84 J/mm3 criterion
surface_integrity does not use WhiteLayerDetectionEngine despite it supporting operation:'grinding'
dress_params has double-assignment bug (line 79 references result before construction)
ANSI B74.13 coverage incomplete — no electroplated/metal bond, no porosity specification

engines.note: 5 electrode materials, wear ratio tables, stage selection
6 wire types, skim cuts, flushing pressure
SAFETY CRITICAL — recast/HAZ/microcrack models, spec limits per industry
Spark gap, discharge energy, aspect ratio limits, WEDG recommendation

issues.finding: WireEDM skim speed formula INVERTED — firstCutSpeed*(2.0-i*0.3) produces skim speeds FASTER than first cut
WireEDM taper speed factor computed but never applied to output
ElectrodeDesign: no electrode replacement count (wear ratio returned but consumption not computed)
MicroEDM: no dielectric/flushing model (critical for aspect ratio >10)
